javadoc:
Class to perform disassembly.  Contains the logic to follow instruction
 flows to continue the disassembly.
 17-Nov-2008: moved to ghidra.program.disassemble package since this is now used during 
 					      language upgrades which may occur during construction of ProgramDB.
 12-Dec-2012: major refactor of disassembly to perform bulk add of instructions to 
 program to avoid context related conflicts

methods.name: getDisassembler
methods.comment:
Get a suitable disassembler instance. 
 Marking of bad instructions honors "Mark Bad Disassembly" 
 program Disassembler option.

params.name: program
params.comment: the program to be disassembled.

params.name: monitor
params.comment: progress monitor

params.name: listener
params.comment: object to notify of disassembly messages.

methods.name: getDisassembler
methods.comment:
Get a suitable disassembler instance.
 Intended for block pseudo-disassembly use only when the method 
 Disassembler#pseudoDisassembleBlock(MemBuffer, RegisterValue, int)
 is used.

params.name: language
params.comment: processor language

params.name: addrFactory
params.comment: address factory

params.name: monitor
params.comment: progress monitor

params.name: listener
params.comment: object to notify of disassembly messages.

methods.name: getDisassembler

params.name: program
params.comment: the program to be disassembled.

params.name: markBadInstructions
params.comment: if true bad instructions will be marked

params.name: markUnimplementedPcode
params.comment: if true instructions with unimplemented pcode will be marked

params.name: restrictToExecuteMemory
params.comment: if true disassembly will only be permitted with executable memory blocks

params.name: monitor
params.comment: progress monitor

params.name: listener
params.comment: object to notify of disassembly messages.

methods.javadoc:
Set seed context which will be used to establish initial context at starting points
 which are not arrived at via a natural disassembly flow.  A null value will disable
 use of any previously set seed context
@param seedContext
methods.name: setSeedContext
methods.comment:
Set seed context which will be used to establish initial context at starting points
 which are not arrived at via a natural disassembly flow.  A null value will disable
 use of any previously set seed context

methods.javadoc:
Set the maximum number of instructions in a single run which contain the same byte values.
 Disassembly flow will stop and be flagged when this threshold is encountered.
 This check is set to MAX_REPEAT_PATTERN_LENGTH by default, and can be disabled by setting a value of -1
 NOTE: This restriction will only work for those cases where a given repeated byte 
 results in an instruction which has a fall-through.
@param maxInstructions limit on the number of consecutive instructions with the same 
 byte values
methods.name: setRepeatPatternLimit
methods.comment:
Set the maximum number of instructions in a single run which contain the same byte values.
 Disassembly flow will stop and be flagged when this threshold is encountered.
 This check is set to MAX_REPEAT_PATTERN_LENGTH by default, and can be disabled by setting a value of -1
 NOTE: This restriction will only work for those cases where a given repeated byte 
 results in an instruction which has a fall-through.

params.name: maxInstructions
params.comment:
limit on the number of consecutive instructions with the same 
 byte values

methods.javadoc:
Set the region over which the repeat pattern limit will be ignored.
 This allows areas which have been explicitly disassembled to be 
 free of bad bookmarks caused by the repeat pattern limit being exceeded.
@param set region over which the repeat pattern limit will be ignored
methods.name: setRepeatPatternLimitIgnored
methods.comment:
Set the region over which the repeat pattern limit will be ignored.
 This allows areas which have been explicitly disassembled to be 
 free of bad bookmarks caused by the repeat pattern limit being exceeded.

params.name: set
params.comment: region over which the repeat pattern limit will be ignored

methods.javadoc:
@param program
@return true if program MARK_BAD_INSTRUCTION_PROPERTY has been enabled
methods.name: isMarkBadDisassemblyOptionEnabled

return.comment: true if program MARK_BAD_INSTRUCTION_PROPERTY has been enabled

methods.javadoc:
@param program
@return true if program MARK_UNIMPL_PCODE_PROPERTY has been enabled
methods.name: isMarkUnimplementedPcodeOptionEnabled

return.comment: true if program MARK_UNIMPL_PCODE_PROPERTY has been enabled

methods.javadoc:
@param program
@return true if program RESTRICT_DISASSEMBLY_TO_EXECUTE_MEMORY_PROPERTY has been enabled
methods.name: isRestrictToExecuteMemory

return.comment: true if program RESTRICT_DISASSEMBLY_TO_EXECUTE_MEMORY_PROPERTY has been enabled

methods.name: disassemble
methods.comment:
Attempt disassembly of all undefined code units within the specified set of addresses.
 NOTE: A single instance of this Disassembler does not support concurrent
 invocations of the various disassemble methods.
 Disassembler must be instantiated with a Program object.

params.name: startSet
params.comment: the minimum set of addresses to disassemble

params.name: restrictedSet
params.comment: the set of addresses that disassembling is restricted to (may be null)

params.name: doFollowFlow
params.comment: flag to follow references while disassembling.

return.comment: the set of addresses that were disassembled.

methods.name: disassemble
methods.comment:
Attempt disassembly of all undefined code units within the specified set of addresses.
 NOTE: A single instance of this Disassembler does not support concurrent
 invocations of the various disassemble methods.
 Disassembler must be instantiated with a Program object.

params.name: startSet
params.comment: the minimum set of addresses to disassemble

params.name: restrictedSet
params.comment: the set of addresses that disassembling is restricted to (may be null)

params.name: initialContextValue
params.comment:
initial context value to be applied at the
 startAddr.  If not null this value will take precedence when combined with
 any seed value or program context.

params.name: doFollowFlow
params.comment: flag to follow references while disassembling.

return.comment: the set of addresses that were disassembled.

methods.name: disassemble
methods.comment:
Disassembles code starting at startAddr and restricted to addrSet.
 NOTE: A single instance of this Disassembler does not support concurrent
 invocations of the various disassemble methods.
 Disassembler must be instantiated with a Program object.

params.name: startAddr
params.comment: the address to begin disassembling.

params.name: restrictedSet
params.comment: the set of addresses that disassembling is restricted to.

return.comment: AddressSet the set of addresses that were disassembled.

methods.name: disassemble
methods.comment:
Disassembles code starting at startAddr and restricted to addrSet.
 NOTE: A single instance of this Disassembler does not support concurrent
 invocations of the various disassemble methods. 
 Disassembler must be instantiated with a Program object.

params.name: startAddr
params.comment: the address to begin disassembling.

params.name: restrictedSet
params.comment: the set of addresses that disassembling is restricted to.

params.name: doFollowFlow
params.comment: flag to follow references while disassembling.

return.comment: AddressSet the set of addresses that were disassembled.

methods.name: disassemble
methods.comment:
Disassembles code starting at startAddr and restricted to addrSet.
 NOTE: A single instance of this Disassembler does not support concurrent
 invocations of the various disassemble methods.  
 Disassembler must be instantiated with a Program object.

params.name: startAddr
params.comment: the address to begin disassembling.

params.name: restrictedSet
params.comment: the set of addresses that disassembling is restricted to.

params.name: initialContextValue
params.comment:
initial context value to be applied at the
 startAddr.  If not null this value will take precedence when combined with
 any seed value or program context.

params.name: doFollowFlow
params.comment: flag to follow references while disassembling.

return.comment: AddressSet the set of addresses that were disassembled.

methods.javadoc:
Clear any retained context state which may have been accumulated.
 Use of this method is only needed when using the pseudoDisassembleBlock 
 method over an extended code range to avoid excessive in-memory state accumulation.
methods.name: resetDisassemblerContext
methods.comment:
Clear any retained context state which may have been accumulated.
 Use of this method is only needed when using the pseudoDisassembleBlock 
 method over an extended code range to avoid excessive in-memory state accumulation.

methods.name: pseudoDisassembleBlock
methods.comment:
Perform a psuedo-disassembly of an single instruction block only following fall-throughs.
 WARNING! This method should not be used in conjunction with other disassembly methods
 on the this Disassembler instance.  Disassembler must be instantiated with a Program object.

params.name: addr
params.comment: start of block

params.name: defaultContextValue
params.comment:
starting context to use if no context has previously been established
 for the specified startAddr

params.name: limit
params.comment: maximum number of instructions to disassemble

methods.name: pseudoDisassembleBlock
methods.comment:
Perform a psuedo-disassembly of an single instruction block only following fall-throughs.
 WARNING! This method should not be used in conjunction with other disassembly methods
 on the this Disassembler instance.

params.name: blockMemBuffer
params.comment: block memory buffer

params.name: defaultContextValue
params.comment:
starting context to use if no context has previously been established
 for the specified startAddr

params.name: limit
params.comment: maximum number of instructions to disassemble

return.comment:
instruction block of pseudo-instructions or null if minimum address of blockMemBuffer 
 is not properly aligned for instruction parsing.

methods.name: markUnimplementedPcode
methods.comment: Mark all instructions with unimplemented pcode over the specified address set

params.name: addressSet
params.comment: restricted address set or null for entire program

methods.name: clearUnimplementedPcodeWarnings
methods.comment: Clear all bookmarks which indicate unimplemented pcode within the specified address set.

params.name: addressSet
params.comment: restricted address set or null for entire program

name: Disassembler
comment:
Class to perform disassembly.  Contains the logic to follow instruction
 flows to continue the disassembly.
 17-Nov-2008: moved to ghidra.program.disassemble package since this is now used during 
 					      language upgrades which may occur during construction of ProgramDB.
 12-Dec-2012: major refactor of disassembly to perform bulk add of instructions to 
 program to avoid context related conflicts

fields.javadoc: MARK_BAD_INSTRUCTION_PROPERTY Program Disassembler property enables marking of instruction disassembly errors. Boolean property is defined within the Disassembler property list, see {@link Program#DISASSEMBLER_PROPERTIES}.
fields.name: MARK_BAD_INSTRUCTION_PROPERTY
fields.comment:
MARK_BAD_INSTRUCTION_PROPERTY Program Disassembler property 
 enables marking of instruction disassembly errors.  Boolean property is defined
 within the Disassembler property list, see Program#DISASSEMBLER_PROPERTIES.

fields.javadoc: MARK_UNIMPL_PCODE_PROPERTY Program Disassembler property enables marking of instructions which are missing their pcode implementation. Boolean property is defined within the Disassembler property list, see {@link Program#DISASSEMBLER_PROPERTIES}.
fields.name: MARK_UNIMPL_PCODE_PROPERTY
fields.comment:
MARK_UNIMPL_PCODE_PROPERTY Program Disassembler property 
 enables marking of instructions which are missing their pcode implementation.  
 Boolean property is defined within the Disassembler property list, see 
 Program#DISASSEMBLER_PROPERTIES.

fields.javadoc: RESTRICT_DISASSEMBLY_TO_EXECUTE_MEMORY_PROPERTY Program Disassembler property restricts disassembly to executable memory only. Boolean property is defined within the Disassembler property list, see {@link Program#DISASSEMBLER_PROPERTIES}.
fields.name: RESTRICT_DISASSEMBLY_TO_EXECUTE_MEMORY_PROPERTY
fields.comment:
RESTRICT_DISASSEMBLY_TO_EXECUTE_MEMORY_PROPERTY Program Disassembler property 
 restricts disassembly to executable memory only.  
 Boolean property is defined within the Disassembler property list, see 
 Program#DISASSEMBLER_PROPERTIES.
